intro: Artanthe trinervia, commonly known as the mountain flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Artanthe trinervia thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
